オプション1: Some time had passed since the attack by the experimental subjects.
The four were building a raft in the open area in front of the ruins.
"The experimental subjects haven't come."
said Square Man.
"Because it's VSCO day."
Triangle Man chuckled.
"VSCO?"
"A streamer that's popular with kids."
said Trapezoid Man.

"The kids call the ones that attack VSCO,
 and the ones that don't attack Vim.
 I don't really know who they're based on, though."

"When kids make up nicknames,
 they tend to pick words you wouldn't like being called."
When Star Man looked at Triangle Man, he averted his eyes and laughed.

Before long they started calling the ones that attacked VSCO,
 and the ones that didn't Vim.

Since that day, no VSCO had attacked.
Star Man and the others devoted themselves to building the boat.
"It's been a while, but how are your legs?"
Star Man asked Trapezoid Man.

"Sorry. I think they're done for. Both were complex fractures
 that really needed surgery. They've set wrong."

In fact they weren't complex fractures but comminuted fractures—
 literally shattered to pieces.

Shattered bones don't knit on their own, so they stayed that way.
A false joint—pseudoarthrosis—had formed.

Multiple pseudoarthroses had formed in the ankle and heel,
 and he could no longer bear weight.

"At first it hurt so much I felt like I'd pass out every second,
 but now, as long as I don't touch it, it doesn't hurt."
"...That's good to hear."
